data.author: Hiral Goyal
data.content: Delhi government on Friday raised the dearness allowance (DA) for labourers amid rising inflation. With this, the monthly wages for unskilled labourers have been raised from ₹16,064 to ₹16,506 and semi-skilled labourers' wages have been increased from ₹17,693 to ₹18,187 per month. "Minimum wages in Delhi are highest in comparison to any other state," Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia claimed.
data.title: Delhi govt raises DA for labourers, claims highest minimum wages in India

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Parts of Delhi and Gurugram received rainfall and strong winds on Friday, bringing some relief from the scorching heat over the past few days. Stormy weather with lightning was also reported from some areas of Noida. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted a dust storm or thunderstorm with light to moderate rainfall in NCR on Saturday.
data.title: Parts of Delhi-NCR receive rainfall, dust storm predicted tomorrow

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: A massive fire broke out at a godown in the Jhandewalan area of Delhi on Friday. As many as 27 fire tenders reached the spot and the blaze was brought under control. Informing about the same, Delhi minister Satyendar Jain said that no injuries or casualties were reported in the fire, which reportedly broke out at around 2.05 pm.
data.title: Massive fire at godown in Delhi's Jhandewalan, 27 tenders reach spot

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: Former media executive Indrani Mukerjea was released from a Mumbai jail on Friday, almost seven years after being arrested in her daughter Sheena Bora's murder case in 2015. "I am very happy," said Mukerjea while leaving Byculla Jail, adding, "Empathy and forgiveness...I have forgiven all the people who have hurt me." She said she has learned "a lot" in jail.
data.title: I've learned a lot in jail: Indrani Mukerjea on being released after 7 years

data.author: Daisy Mowke
data.content: Amid cases of monkeypox in few countries, government has directed officials to keep a close watch on the situation, PTI reported quoting official sources. Government also directed airport and port health officers to be vigilant. "They've been instructed that any sick passenger with travel history to...affected countries be isolated and samples sent...for investigation," an official source said.
data.title: Keep a close watch, isolate sick passengers: Govt amid monkeypox cases in Europe

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: The Home Affairs Ministry has announced that 1998-batch IAS officer Gyanesh Bharti has been appointed as the Commissioner of the unified Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Meanwhile, Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as the Special Officer in the unified MCD. The South, North and East civic bodies will be treated as one Municipal Corporation of Delhi from May 22.
data.title: Gyanesh Bharti appointed as Commissioner of unified MCD

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: The government has issued a statement on reports of a second Chinese bridge being constructed across the Pangong Lake in Ladakh by China. "Both these bridges are in areas that have continued to be under illegal occupation of China since the 1960s," said the government. "We've never accepted such illegal occupation of our territory," it added.
data.title: It's in illegally-occupied area: Govt on reports of 2nd Chinese bridge on Pangong

data.author: Sakshita Khosla
data.content: A day after an under-construction tunnel in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district collapsed, a part of a nearby hill caved in on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway on Friday. The incident took place in the Makerkote area and a video of the same has also surfaced. One labourer has died while around nine others are still feared trapped in the tunnel.
data.title: Part of hill falls on J&K highway near tunnel collapse site, video surfaces

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: The Trinamool Congress distributed umbrellas and food packets to the flood-hit people in Agartala. The food donation drive was led by Tripura TMC President Subal Bhowmik and state in-charge Rajib Banerjee. "Waterlogging has created havoc in several places in the North East," Bhowmik said, alleging that the BJP-led Tripura government "has done nothing" in four years to solve this crisis.
data.title: TMC distributes food, umbrellas to people in flood-hit Agartala

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: A day after a newly-wed couple was found dead in Kanpur, the police arrested the man's father in the case. Police said that they arrested Deepak, a tea vendor, as he was present in the house when the incident took place. "Deepak later confessed to his crime, claiming that he killed his son and daughter-in-law with a knife," police said.
data.title: Man arrested for murdering son and daughter-in-law in UP's Kanpur

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) rescued a cancer patient who was returning after treatment and got stuck at Haflong railway station amid the floods in Assam. IAF officials said that the patient was shifted to a nearby area safely. The floods have affected over 3.31 lakh people in Assam's Nagaon district alone, Assam State Disaster Management Authority said.
data.title: Indian Air Force rescues cancer patient from flood-hit Assam

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Indian agencies have arrested a gang of international smugglers and seized around 218 kilograms of heroin worth more than ₹1,500 crore off the Lakshadweep coast. The heroin was recovered from two fishing boats named "Prince" and "Little Jesus". The recovery was made during a joint operation conducted by Indian Coast Guard (ICG) and Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI).
data.title: Indian Coast Guard seizes 218 kg drugs worth over ₹1,500 crore

data.author: Subhangi Singh
data.content: GB Nagar's education department released list of 16 private schools which were running without recognition certificates in the district and directed for their closure with immediate effect. The private schools that have been found violating the rules are located at Garhi Chaukhandi, Mamura, Raipur Bangar, Maincha, Nangla Nainsukh, Salarpur, Madalpur, Jhajhar Road, Bhaipur Brahmanan and Wajidpur.
data.title: 16 pvt schools to shut in GB Nagar for operating without recognition

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: National Investigation Agency on Friday conducted searches at seven places in Jharkhand in terror funding case of Magadh Amrapali Colliery, ANI reported. During the searches, the NIA reportedly recovered over ₹3 lakh in cash. The case pertains to raising of terror funds and money laundering by splinter group of Naxals in Left Wing Extremism affected states of Jharkhand and Bihar.
data.title: NIA raids 7 places in Jharkhand in terror funding case

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: The New Development Bank (NDB), established by the BRICS countries, has announced that it plans to open its Indian Regional Office at Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT City). The office aims to cater to infrastructure and sustainable development needs of the country. "IRO will be instrumental in enhancing...engagement with borrowers and stakeholders," NDB President Marcos Troyjo said.
data.title: BRICS-led New Development Bank to set up regional office in India

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Supreme Court has vacated a stay on the Delhi High Court order, which said that "stray dogs have the right to food and citizens have the right to feed them". The verdict comes as a relief to animal welfare organisations involved in feeding stray dogs. The Supreme Court had put the stay on the HC order on an NGO's plea.
data.title: SC lifts stay on Delhi HC order on right to feed stray dogs

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that India is now among the top 25 countries exporting in the defence sector while hailing the current government for India's development. "(Earlier) defence weapons were only bought from outside...Tanks, rockets, missiles and ammunition [were] all imported," Rajnath Singh said while addressing party workers. "India is now respected in the world," he added.
data.title: India among top 25 countries exporting in defence: Rajnath Singh

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea in connection with a money laundering case filed by Enforcement Directorate was rejected by a special court. Through his lawyer, Sachin Waze sought bail, saying he was not arrested during the probe and keeping him in custody was unnecessary. ED prosecutor said other crimes registered against Waze should be considered.
data.title: Former Mumbai Police officer Sachin Waze's bail plea rejected

data.author: Shailesh
data.content: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is setting up Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC) to address all civic grievances. The ICCC will also act as a centre to monitor disaster management and traffic movement, according to a report. "It would be citizen oriented and enable quick response to citizens' concerns," Deputy Municipal Commissioner Pratibha Patil said.
data.title: Pune civic body to set up centralised command centre for civic issues

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Two men who posed as policemen and extorted ₹18,000 from a grocer were arrested by Bhayandar Police. The incident occurred on May 3 when the victim was on his way to deliver goods and was stopped by the duo, who accused him of selling banned gutka. They then snatched the money from him and fled.
data.title: 2 held for extorting ₹18,000 by posing as policemen in Bhayandar

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Officials said that a couple sleeping outside their house in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district was attacked by a herd of wild elephants from neighbouring Chhattisgarh. "The woman was trampled to death by the elephants, while her husband escaped with minor injuries," said the Jaisinghnagar forest range officer. The deceased's family was given a compensation of ₹4 lakh, the official added.
data.title: Woman killed in attack by wild elephants in MP's Shahdol

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Police said that two persons were arrested after a raid on a cash collection centre of an online betting racket in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. Siddharth Bahuguna, Jabalpur SP, said that two more accused are absconding. "We have found ₹21.55 lakh in one locker at the centre," Bahuguna said. He added that the Income Tax Department was intimated for further probe.
data.title: Online betting racket busted in Jabalpur, ₹21.55 lakh recovered

data.author: Dharini Mudgal
data.content: Karnataka HC has directed a Bengaluru-based company to pay a ₹10 lakh compensation to the employee who was terminated after he declined to undergo a performance improvement program. Since the employee was terminated without holding an enquiry, he's eligible for compensation, it said. However, it didn't allow his reinstatement to the job due to loss of mutual trust with employer.
data.title: HC orders company to pay ₹10 lakh to terminated employee in B'luru

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: Police said that a 28-year-old man identified as Sainath Jadhav was killed with an axe at Nalasopara in Maharashtra's Palghar in the early hours of Friday. The victim was killed by 18-year-old Roopesh Thackeray when Jadhav tried to rescue his relative from being attacked, the police added. The accused was later arrested by Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police.
data.title: Man killed with an axe in Palghar, accused arrested

data.author: Apoorva Shankar
data.content: The Mayor of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation said that vendors and other persons were fined after they were caught littering leftover flowers, despite repeated notices served to them. Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal added that the intention behind this was to keep the surroundings tidy. "Swachh Survekshan is everyone's social responsibility," she tweeted.
data.title: Vendors caught littering leftover flowers fined: Hyderabad Mayor
